article.headline: George Mason 67, Drexel 48
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP) -- Jai Lewis scored 19 points and George Mason reached the 20-win plateau in the regular season for the second time in school history with a 67-48 victory over Drexel on Wednesday night. Will Thomas added 15 points and nine rebounds for the Patriots (20-5, 14-2 Colonial Athletic Association), who matched their best regular-season mark since the 1983-84 season. George Mason, which ranks sixth in the nation in field goal percentage defense, held the Dragons (13-14, 7-9) to 31 percent shooting to win for the 13th time in 14 games. Dominick Mejia scored 13 points for Drexel, which has lost six of seven. Lewis sparked a 7-0 run early in the second half as the Patriots extended a six-point halftime lead to 37-24. George Mason pushed the lead as high as 23 in the final minutes. George Mason's Tony Skinn and Drexel's Kenell Sanchez were ejected after an altercation with 5:41 remaining. It was unclear after the game whether the referees had ruled they were fighting, which would trigger an automatic one-game suspension for both players under conference rules. <

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
